scenes.raw_text: KELLER: Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come... ...thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread... ...and forgive us our trespasses... ...as we forgive those who trespass against us. Lead us not into temptation... ...but deliver us from evil. For the kingdom, the power and the glory are yours... ...now and forever. Amen. (BIRD SQUAWKING) (THUNDER RUMBLES) WEATHERMAN: Looking at mostly cloudy skies and with lows in the upper 20s... ...there will be some refreeze on some of the roads... ...so slick spots are possible tonight in isolated... You know the most important thing your granddad ever taught me? Hmm? Be ready. Hurricane, flood, whatever it ends up being. No more food gets delivered to the grocery store, gas stations dry up. People just turn on each other, and, uh... All of a sudden, all that stands between you and being dead is you. I'm proud of you, son. It was a nice shot. (GENE MacLELLAN'S "PUT YOUR HAND IN THE HAND" PLAYING OVER THE RADIO) Put your hand in the hand of the man Who stilled the water Put your hand in the hand of the man Who calmed the sea Take a look at yourself And you can look at others differently (DOG BARKING) Every time I look into the holy book I wanna tremble GRACE: Hey, come on, hon. (ANNA HUMMING) GRACE: Wait. I forgot something. Hold on a second, Anna! KELLER: Ralph, you have the venison? RALPH: Yup. GRACE: I forgot the pie. (ANNA CONTINUES HUMMING) Are we taking the truck? We're going up the street, you dope. Come on. GRACE: Hey, wait for your mother, please. Give me a ride. KELLER: Oh, you're getting heavy. RALPH: Danny's dad said he'd sell me their old car. I got half of what I need saved from the summer. - I thought maybe... - Forget it. I can barely get enough carpentry work to keep up with the mortgage. Why don't you rent out Grandpa's old apartment house? (GRACE CHUCKLES) Like I keep telling your mother, it's an old building. It'll cost a fortune to fix it up. KELLER: Oh. (RALPH COUGHS) (DOORBELL RINGING) KELLER: Hey. GRACE: Okay, okay. NANCY: They're here! (CLASSICAL MUSIC PLAYING FROM SPEAKER) GRACE: - Hello. - Happy Thanksgiving. KELLER: Anna, wait until we're invited. For God's sake, Keller. Get the hell in here.

Hmm... I went for a drive? You went for a drive? You weren't driving. I know girls were playing outside your RV. You weren't driving. It was parked. Was it a special day? - Were you planning on taking two little girls? - No. - Have you done that before? - No. LOKI: Did you ask them to come inside? ALEX: No. LOKI: You ask them to come in... - ...and then you take them away? ALEX: - No. LOKI: - You put those girls somewhere? - May I sit? - Come on. - Please don't touch me. My aunt's house. LOKI: Your aunt's house? ALEX: She lets me park it in the back yard. Grass don't grow back there anyway. AUNT: It was my husband's. For sale, if you want it. No, thanks. Would you tell me what you're doing on my property then? I'm just glad to know where he is. He's always home before dark, and... ...I just don't understand. That boy has never been in trouble, not a day in his life. In the summertime, he sleeps out in the camper some, but... ...this time of year he sleeps in here on the sofa bed. That's my husband. We had a fight, jeez, five years ago. Walked out, didn't come back. Alex loved him like a father. LOKI: Where are Alex's real parents? My husband's brother and his girlfriend... ...they died in a car accident when Alex was about 6. LOKI: Sorry to hear that. He doesn't have much. What have you got? Well, this thing's clean.

scenes.raw_text: I mean, it's filthy as shit, but we didn't find anything. You didn't find any wool fibers, anything like that? The girls could be wearing some wool gloves or wool hat, no cotton fibers? If he was using this to transport them, I might buy that. But if there had been a struggle, I would have found something. I'd start looking in the woods by the rest stop. Yeah, half the uniformed cops in the state are doing that right now. When you're done with this thing, can you send a crew over to the aunt's house? (INDISTINCT CHATTERING) Anna? Anna? FRANKLIN: Thanks for coming. Franklin Birch. My wife's in here. Honey? Her name's Nancy. Detective Loki is... Honey? These photos are better than the ones my husband gave you. You can see her eyes more clearly. GRACE: So did we pass? I'm sorry, what did you say? The poly thing, the lie detector we took this morning. Did we pass? Oh, yeah. Sorry. Yes. We appreciate your cooperation. It's embarrassing, all the... All this fuss. Everyone's gonna think we're crazy... ...when those two come out of hiding, wherever they are. Do you have some reason to believe they ran away? No. They're happy. They must have run away. I think they must have run away. Right? Um... Your police captain told me that you've solved every case... ...that you've ever been assigned. Is that right? Sorry. I am so sorry. Do you have children, detective? I'm gonna find your daughter. We believe they came back here after they left you at the Birches' yesterday. They were looking for Anna's red whistle. LOKI: Right. I read your statement. I'm Detective Loki. I'm heading up the investigation into your daughter's disappearance. Please sit down. My son already told you that the guy was inside the RV just watching them, right? We haven't found any physical evidence inside the RV. Or his aunt's house where he lives. - Nothing? LOKI: - Alex Jones... ...unfortunately has the I.Q. of a 10-year-old. There's no way someone with the I.Q. of a 10-year-old... ...could abduct two girls in broad daylight, and then... ...somehow make them disappear. Well, how can he drive an RV? If he can't answer a question... Well, he has a legal Pennsylvania license. And he ran, right? They said he tried to run away. Why"? Why? Why would he run? I've just spent 10 hours questioning this boy.
